teamHighlights.Argentina: Defending World Cup champions continued their dominance in South American qualifiers. Lionel Messi led the team with exceptional performances, while emerging talents like Julian Alvarez proved crucial.
teamHighlights.France: Les Bleus showed strong form in European qualifiers. Kylian Mbappé continued his prolific scoring run while the defense remained solid under Didier Deschamps' tactical setup.
teamHighlights.Brazil: A Seleção experienced a rebuilding phase under new management. Young talents like Endrick and Rodrygo stepped up while veterans provided crucial experience in tight matches.
teamHighlights.England: The Three Lions showed improved tactical flexibility. Harry Kane remained the team's talisman while Jude Bellingham emerged as a world-class midfielder orchestrating play.
teamHighlights.Germany: Die Mannschaft focused on integrating young talent with experienced players. Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala formed an exciting creative partnership in midfield.
teamHighlights.Spain: La Roja dominated European qualification with their trademark possession-based football. Young stars Pedri and Gavi controlled midfield while veteran leaders provided stability.
teamHighlights.Netherlands: Oranje showed solid defensive organization while maintaining attacking flair. Cody Gakpo emerged as a key player with crucial goals in qualifying.
teamHighlights.Portugal: A Seleção balanced experienced stars with exciting young talent. Cristiano Ronaldo continued his incredible international goal-scoring record while Rafael Leão dazzled on the wing.
teamHighlights.Belgium: The Red Devils underwent a generational transition. While golden generation stars remained important, new faces began establishing themselves in the squad.
teamHighlights.Italy: Gli Azzurri continued their tactical excellence under Luciano Spalletti. Strong defensive foundations combined with creative midfield play characterized their campaign.
teamHighlights.Mexico: El Tri topped the CONCACAF qualifying round. A blend of Liga MX stars and European-based players provided depth, with Santiago Giménez leading the attack.
teamHighlights.USA: The USMNT showcased their golden generation on home soil qualification. Christian Pulisic starred while the team built momentum heading into hosting the tournament.
teamHighlights.Canada: Les Rouges continued their remarkable rise in world football. Alphonso Davies led from the back while Jonathan David provided consistent goal-scoring.
teamHighlights.Japan: Samurai Blue impressed in Asian qualification with technical excellence. A wealth of European-based talent provided quality throughout the squad.
teamHighlights.South Korea: Taegeuk Warriors showed resilience in Asian qualifying. Son Heung-min captained the team while young talents stepped up in crucial moments.
teamHighlights.Australia: The Socceroos battled through a tough Asian qualifying campaign. A mix of experienced campaigners and rising stars kept World Cup dreams alive.
teamHighlights.Algeria: Les Fennecs showed strong form in African qualifying. A balanced squad combined technical skill with physical presence to secure their spot in the tournament.
teamHighlights.Morocco: The Atlas Lions built on their historic 2022 World Cup run. Achraf Hakimi and Hakim Ziyech continued to shine as Morocco established themselves among Africa's elite.
teamHighlights.Senegal: The Lions of Teranga continued their strong African presence. Despite losing Sadio Mané to injury at times, depth in the squad proved vital.
teamHighlights.Nigeria: The Super Eagles showed resilience in a competitive African qualifying group. Victor Osimhen led the attack with world-class finishing.
teamHighlights.Egypt: The Pharaohs qualified with Mohamed Salah leading from the front. The Liverpool star remained the focal point of Egypt's attacking play.
teamHighlights.Cameroon: The Indomitable Lions showed their fighting spirit in qualifying. A blend of experienced campaigners and emerging talents kept them competitive.
teamHighlights.South Africa: Bafana Bafana qualified for their first World Cup since 2010. A new generation of talent emerged under Hugo Broos' guidance.
teamHighlights.Tunisia: The Eagles of Carthage showed tactical discipline throughout qualifying. Their organized defensive structure proved difficult to break down.
teamHighlights.Iran: Team Melli continued their Asian dominance. Mehdi Taremi and Sardar Azmoun formed a lethal attacking partnership in qualifying.
teamHighlights.Indonesia: Garuda made history by qualifying for their first-ever World Cup. Naturalized players and emerging local talents combined to achieve the nation's greatest footballing moment.
teamHighlights.Saudi Arabia: The Green Falcons built on their shock 2022 World Cup win over Argentina. Investment in domestic talent development showed positive results.
teamHighlights.Qatar: The 2022 World Cup hosts showed improvement in Asian qualifying. Home tournament experience provided valuable lessons for the squad.
teamHighlights.Uzbekistan: The White Wolves qualified for their first World Cup. A golden generation finally achieved the breakthrough after years of near-misses.
teamHighlights.Croatia: The Vatreni continued their remarkable tournament pedigree. Despite an aging core, quality in midfield remained world-class.
teamHighlights.Denmark: Danish Dynamite remained competitive in European qualifying. The team showed tactical versatility under Kasper Hjulmand.
teamHighlights.Switzerland: The Nati showed their typical consistency in European qualifying. Granit Xhaka's leadership from midfield proved invaluable.
teamHighlights.Austria: Das Team impressed with attacking football under Ralf Rangnick. High pressing and quick transitions defined their style.
teamHighlights.Poland: The White Eagles qualified with Robert Lewandowski still leading the line. The Barcelona striker remained Poland's most important player.
teamHighlights.Serbia: The Eagles showed attacking flair in qualifying. Dušan Vlahović and Aleksandar Mitrović formed a dangerous strike partnership.
teamHighlights.Ukraine: Despite immense challenges off the pitch, Ukraine showed remarkable spirit. The team united a nation through their qualifying campaign.
teamHighlights.Turkey: The Crescent-Stars showed exciting attacking play. Young talents like Arda Güler emerged as key players for the future.
teamHighlights.Scotland: The Tartan Army qualified for back-to-back major tournaments. John McGinn and Scott McTominay drove the team forward.
teamHighlights.Hungary: The Magyars continued their impressive run under Marco Rossi. Dominik Szoboszlai emerged as one of Europe's brightest talents.
teamHighlights.Czech Republic: The Czech Lions showed solid defensive organization. Patrik Schick remained the team's primary goal threat.
teamHighlights.Slovenia: Slovenia qualified for their first World Cup since 2010. Jan Oblak's goalkeeping excellence anchored the team's defense.
teamHighlights.Wales: The Dragons qualified through determination and team spirit. Despite Gareth Bale's retirement, new leaders emerged.
teamHighlights.Uruguay: La Celeste showed their traditional fighting spirit. Darwin Núñez led the line while veterans provided experience.
teamHighlights.Colombia: Los Cafeteros returned to form in South American qualifying. Luis Díaz dazzled on the wing with exceptional performances.
teamHighlights.Ecuador: La Tri continued their South American emergence. Young talents combined with experienced players for consistent performances.
teamHighlights.Paraguay: La Albirroja qualified through disciplined performances. The team showed improved organization under new management.
teamHighlights.Chile: La Roja navigated a challenging transition period. A new generation began to establish themselves in the squad.
teamHighlights.Peru: La Blanquirroja showed fighting spirit in qualifying. Paolo Guerrero provided veteran leadership to a developing squad.
teamHighlights.Venezuela: La Vinotinto made history qualifying for their first World Cup. A breakthrough moment for Venezuelan football.
teamHighlights.Costa Rica: Los Ticos showed their tournament experience in CONCACAF qualifying. Solid defensive structure remained their trademark.
teamHighlights.Panama: Los Canaleros qualified for their second World Cup. Physical presence and set-piece prowess remained key strengths.
teamHighlights.Honduras: La H qualified through determination and team effort. The Central American side showed improvement in their campaign.
teamHighlights.Jamaica: The Reggae Boyz qualified through a strong defensive record. The team showed improved tactical discipline throughout.
teamHighlights.New Zealand: The All Whites dominated Oceania qualifying. Chris Wood led the attack with crucial goals throughout the campaign.
teamHighlights.Bolivia: La Verde used home altitude advantage effectively. The team showed resilience in South American qualifying.
teamHighlights.DR Congo: The Leopards qualified for their first World Cup since 1974. A historic achievement for Congolese football.
teamHighlights.Iraq: The Lions of Mesopotamia showed promising form. A blend of youth and experience drove their qualifying campaign.
teamHighlights.Jordan: Al-Nashama made history by qualifying for their first-ever FIFA World Cup. Under coach Jamal Sellami, Jordan reached the 2025 FIFA Arab Cup final and dominated Asian qualification with clinical performances.

cityDescriptions.newYork:
Hosting the Grand Final, New York/New Jersey offers an unparalleled experience. As a world-class hub for entertainment, dining, and shopping, visitors can explore iconic attractions from the Manhattan skyline to the Jersey Shore.

The region boasts Michelin-starred restaurants, Broadway shows, and a vibrant cultural scene that never sleeps. It is the perfect backdrop for the tournament's climax.
cityDescriptions.dallas:
Hosting the most matches of any venue (9 total), Dallas is a sports mecca. The city features a vibrant arts scene, sprawling entertainment districts, and authentic Tex-Mex cuisine that defines the region's flavor.

Visitors can explore historic landmarks and enjoy true Southern hospitality in a city that blends modern innovation with cowboy culture.
cityDescriptions.losAngeles:
The entertainment capital of the world, Los Angeles will host the USA's opening match. With year-round sunshine and blue skies, fans can enjoy endless attractions from Hollywood to beautiful beaches.

SoFi Stadium is a revolutionary indoor-outdoor venue that perfectly reflects the city's innovative spirit and glamorous lifestyle.
cityDescriptions.atlanta:
Atlanta, hosting a Semi-Final, is a city of rich history and modern energy. Known for its thriving arts scene and diverse neighborhoods, it offers a unique blend of Southern charm and urban sophistication.

Mercedes-Benz Stadium is an architectural marvel with a retractable roof, located in the heart of a city filled with historic landmarks and family-friendly attractions.
cityDescriptions.miami:
Hosting the Bronze Final, Miami is an oceanfront hotspot known for its legendary nightlife, unique Art Deco architecture, and fantastic dining scene.

With great weather and a vibrant Latin influence, South Beach offers a party atmosphere like no other, making it a top destination for fans looking for sun and fun.
cityDescriptions.sanFrancisco:
The San Francisco Bay Area is a global hub of tech innovation and cultural diversity. Visitors can enjoy the stunning bay views, world-class wine country nearby, and a progressive culinary scene.

Levi's Stadium is a high-tech, LEED Gold certified venue that mirrors the region's commitment to sustainability and innovation.
cityDescriptions.seattle:
Seattle offers unique Pacific Northwest charm, surrounded by water, mountains, and evergreen forests. Known for its coffee culture and tech industry, it has a passionate soccer fan base.

Lumen Field is famous for its deafening atmosphere, providing an intense and exciting environment for World Cup matches.
cityDescriptions.houston:
Houston is a diverse metropolis with a vibrant restaurant scene and nightlife. Home to the Space Center Houston and a renowned Museum District, it offers plenty of cultural exploration.

The city is known for its Southern hospitality and energy, making it a welcoming host for fans from around the world.
cityDescriptions.philadelphia:
Where history meets innovation, Philadelphia is the birthplace of the United States. Visitors can tour Independence Hall and enjoy the city's famous cheesesteaks and Tastykakes.

Lincoln Financial Field hosts matches in a city with a passionate sports culture and a deep historical significance.
cityDescriptions.kansasCity:
The 'Soccer Capital of America' in the Midwest, Kansas City is famous for its BBQ and jazz heritage. Arrowhead Stadium holds the Guinness World Record for the loudest crowd roar.

Fans can expect an electric atmosphere and a warm welcome in this sport-loving city.
cityDescriptions.boston:
A cultural and historical hub, Boston offers a rich Revolutionary War heritage and picturesque New England scenery.

Gillette Stadium will host a Quarter-Final match, bringing world-class soccer to a region known for its championship sports history.
cityDescriptions.mexicoCity:
Hosting the Opening Match, Mexico City is a historic capital rich in cultural heritage. Estadio Azteca is a legendary venue, the only one to host three World Cup openers.

Visitors can explore ancient Aztec ruins, colonial architecture, and a vibrant street food scene in one of the world's largest and most dynamic cities.
cityDescriptions.monterrey:
Known as an industrial hub with modern infrastructure, Monterrey offers stunning mountain views and a passionate football culture.

Estadio BBVA, nicknamed 'The Steel Giant', is a modern architectural marvel set against a dramatic natural backdrop.
cityDescriptions.guadalajara:
Guadalajara is the heart of Mexican tradition, known for mariachi music, tequila, and colonial architecture.

Estadio Akron features a unique volcano-inspired design. The city offers a festive atmosphere and a deep connection to Mexico's cultural roots.
cityDescriptions.toronto:
A cosmopolitan metropolis on the shores of Lake Ontario, Toronto is known for its diversity and culture. It will host Canada's opening match.

The city offers a vibrant arts scene, diverse dining, and iconic landmarks like the CN Tower. BMO Field provides an intimate and energetic soccer experience.
cityDescriptions.vancouver:
Nestled between mountains and the ocean, Vancouver offers stunning Pacific Northwest scenery and a laid-back vibe.

BC Place features a beautiful retractable roof. Visitors can enjoy outdoor adventures, a thriving food scene, and the natural beauty that surrounds this coastal city.

welcomeMessages.kansasCity: Welcome to the Heart of America! I see you've arrived in Kansas City. A quick heads-up: Parking at the stadium is extremely restricted today. I have secured your 'Stadium Direct' bus pass and mapped the shuttle pickup at Union Station. Since you have 3 hours before kickoff, would you like the walking route to the WWI Museum Fan Fest for a photo at the Heart Gateway?
welcomeMessages.newYork: Welcome to the Big Apple! I've noted your arrival in New York. The PATH trains and NJ Transit are running extended hours for match days. MetLife Stadium is in New Jersey - I've mapped the fastest route from your location. Would you like me to set a departure reminder accounting for stadium security lines?
welcomeMessages.losAngeles: Welcome to LA! Traffic is always a factor here - I've calculated that leaving 3 hours before kickoff from your location will get you to SoFi Stadium comfortably. The Metro E Line has a direct station at the stadium. Would you like cooling station locations mapped? It's expected to be 85°F at kickoff.
welcomeMessages.miami: Welcome to Miami! The heat and humidity are real - I've mapped cooling stations inside Hard Rock Stadium. Pro tip: The Brightline train from Downtown Miami connects to stadium shuttles. Want me to calculate optimal departure time from your hotel?
welcomeMessages.dallas: Howdy and welcome to Dallas! AT&T Stadium is massive - I recommend arriving 2 hours early to explore. DART Rail connects downtown to Arlington Transit for stadium access. Would you like me to map the best BBQ spots for pre-game fuel?
welcomeMessages.houston: Welcome to Space City! Houston's diverse dining scene is perfect for pre-match meals. The METRORail has extended service on match days. Be prepared for Texas heat - I've located all cooling stations at NRG Stadium.
welcomeMessages.atlanta: Welcome to the ATL! Mercedes-Benz Stadium has the most affordable concessions in American sports. MARTA runs direct to the Dome/GWCC station. Would you like recommendations for the best wings before the match?
welcomeMessages.philadelphia: Welcome to Philly! I see you've arrived in the birthplace of American democracy. SEPTA Regional Rail runs extended service to Lincoln Financial Field. Don't forget to grab a cheesesteak - I can recommend the best spots!
welcomeMessages.seattle: Welcome to the Emerald City! Lumen Field's atmosphere is legendary - it holds the record for crowd noise. Sound Transit Link Light Rail runs directly to the stadium. Would you like coffee shop recommendations for pre-match caffeine?
welcomeMessages.boston: Welcome to Beantown! Gillette Stadium is in Foxborough - I recommend the commuter rail from South Station. Would you like me to map the best clam chowder spots for your World Cup experience?
welcomeMessages.sanFrancisco: Welcome to the Bay Area! Levi's Stadium is in Santa Clara - Caltrain and VTA light rail connect directly. Wine country is just an hour away if you have rest days. Want recommendations for the best tech cafes?
welcomeMessages.toronto: Welcome to Toronto! BMO Field is right downtown - the TTC streetcar stops at the stadium. The diverse dining scene is perfect for international visitors. Would you like poutine recommendations?
welcomeMessages.vancouver: Welcome to Vancouver! BC Place is downtown with excellent SkyTrain access. The mountain and ocean views are stunning - I can map scenic routes to the stadium if you want to walk.
welcomeMessages.mexicoCity: ¡Bienvenido a la Ciudad de México! Estadio Azteca is a legendary venue - the Metro has direct access. Be mindful of the altitude (2,240m) - hydrate more than usual. Would you like me to map the best taco stands?
welcomeMessages.guadalajara: ¡Bienvenido a Guadalajara! The tequila capital welcomes you. Estadio Akron is accessible by macrobús. Would you like mariachi dinner recommendations before the match?
welcomeMessages.monterrey: ¡Bienvenido a Monterrey! The mountain backdrop at Estadio BBVA is spectacular. Metrorrey provides stadium access. The city's cabrito (goat) cuisine is a must-try - want recommendations?

kansasCity.trap: Arrowhead Stadium has 22,000 parking spots, but only 4,000 are available for the public. No ticket, no entry to the grounds.
kansasCity.solution: Use ConnectKC26. The app links to 215+ motorcoaches running 'Stadium Direct' routes from regional hubs (Lawrence, Overland Park, Independence, Downtown).
transit: KC Streetcar (free) - Power & Light District to Fan Festival at Liberty Memorial
RideKC Bus - Multiple routes to stadium on match days
Stadium Direct Shuttles from Union Station

newYork.trap: MetLife Stadium is in East Rutherford, NJ - not Manhattan. Traffic on match days can add 2+ hours to your journey.
newYork.solution: Take NJ Transit from Penn Station to Meadowlands Station (direct service on match days). Avoid driving.
transit: NJ Transit - Direct trains from Penn Station to Meadowlands
NY Waterway Ferry + Shuttle combo from Manhattan
PATH train to Hoboken + NJ Transit connection

losAngeles.trap: LA traffic is legendary. SoFi Stadium has limited parking and can take 90+ minutes to exit after matches.
losAngeles.solution: Take the Metro E Line direct to Downtown Inglewood station, then walk or shuttle to stadium.
transit: Metro E Line - Direct to Downtown Inglewood
Stadium Express Bus from Union Station
LAX FlyAway + Metro connection

miami.trap: Hard Rock Stadium has limited public transit. Surge pricing on rideshares can exceed $100 after matches.
miami.solution: Book rideshares in advance or use official stadium shuttles from Tri-Rail stations.
transit: Brightline + Stadium Shuttle from MiamiCentral
Tri-Rail to Metrorail to Stadium Express
Pre-booked rideshare with scheduled pickup

dallas.trap: AT&T Stadium is in Arlington, which has minimal public transit. Parking can exceed $75 on match days.
dallas.solution: Use DART Rail to downtown, then Arlington TEXRail connection with match-day shuttles.
transit: DART Rail + TEXRail to Arlington
Official stadium shuttle from downtown Dallas
Pre-paid parking at remote lots with shuttle

houston.trap: NRG Stadium is surrounded by parking lots, but exits can take 90+ minutes. Heat can exceed 100°F.
houston.solution: METRORail runs extended hours on match days. Park at remote lots with shuttle service.
transit: METRORail Red Line to NRG Park station
Park & Ride from downtown Houston
Stadium Express from multiple hubs

atlanta.trap: Downtown traffic converges at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Street parking is almost non-existent.
atlanta.solution: MARTA is your best friend - the Dome/GWCC station is steps from the stadium.
transit: MARTA Rail to Dome/GWCC/Philips Arena/CNN Center
AtlantaLINK shuttle from Buckhead
Bike share stations near the stadium

philadelphia.trap: Lincoln Financial Field shares a complex with multiple venues. Event overlap creates parking nightmares.
philadelphia.solution: SEPTA Broad Street Line runs to NRG station with expanded match-day service.
transit: SEPTA Broad Street Line to AT&T Station
SEPTA Regional Rail to Temple University + shuttle
Official shuttles from Center City

seattle.trap: Lumen Field is downtown, but post-match crowds flood I-5 and I-90. Traffic can be brutal.
seattle.solution: Sound Transit Link Light Rail runs directly to Stadium Station - by far the easiest option.
transit: Sound Transit Link Light Rail to Stadium Station
Sounder Train on match days from suburbs
Water Taxi from West Seattle + walk

boston.trap: Gillette Stadium is 25 miles from downtown Boston in Foxborough. There's no direct subway access.
boston.solution: MBTA Commuter Rail runs match-day service to Foxboro Station, steps from the stadium.
transit: MBTA Commuter Rail to Foxboro Station
Official coaches from South Station
Pre-booked rideshare with return scheduled

sanFrancisco.trap: Levi's Stadium is in Santa Clara (45+ miles from SF). BART doesn't go there directly.
sanFrancisco.solution: Caltrain + VTA Light Rail is the winning combo. Stadium Express buses also run from multiple cities.
transit: Caltrain to Mountain View + VTA Light Rail
Capitol Corridor Amtrak + VTA connection
Stadium Express from SF, Oakland, San Jose

toronto.trap: BMO Field is at Exhibition Place. Gardiner Expressway traffic makes driving unpredictable.
toronto.solution: TTC streetcar (509/510) runs directly to Exhibition. It's the easiest stadium access in North America.
transit: TTC Streetcar 509/510 to Exhibition
UP Express to Union + Streetcar
GO Transit from suburbs to Union Station

vancouver.trap: BC Place is downtown, but bridges into Vancouver create bottlenecks. Parking is expensive.
vancouver.solution: SkyTrain is fast and reliable - Stadium-Chinatown station is at the stadium door.
transit: SkyTrain Expo/Millennium Line to Stadium-Chinatown
SeaBus from North Vancouver + SkyTrain
Canada Line from YVR Airport

mexicoCity.trap: Estadio Azteca is in south Mexico City. Traffic in the world's 5th-largest metro is intense.
mexicoCity.solution: Metro Line 2 goes directly to Tasqueña, then Tren Ligero to Estadio Azteca station.
transit: Metro Line 2 + Tren Ligero to Estadio Azteca
Metrobús Line 1 to Huipulco + walk
Official stadium shuttles from Centro

guadalajara.trap: Estadio Akron is outside the city center. Taxis can surge 3-4x on match days.
guadalajara.solution: Macrobús Line 2 runs to Arcos de Zapopan - then shuttle or short taxi to stadium.
transit: Macrobús Line 2 to Arcos de Zapopan
Official shuttles from Centro Histórico
Uber/DiDi with pre-scheduled pickup

monterrey.trap: Estadio BBVA is in Guadalupe. City traffic can be heavy, especially on Sundays.
monterrey.solution: Metrorrey Line 2 + stadium shuttle is the smart move. Pre-book taxis for return.
transit: Metrorrey Line 2 to General I. Zaragoza + shuttle
Ecovía bus rapid transit
Pre-booked taxi with return trip

history.title: World Cup History
history.subtitle: 22 tournaments of football glory
history.tapToSee: Tap a country to see their winning campaigns

highlights.Brazil1958: A 17-year-old Pelé announced himself to the world, scoring 6 goals including 2 in the final. Brazil's first World Cup triumph introduced 'jogo bonito' (the beautiful game) to global audiences.
highlights.Brazil1962: Despite losing Pelé to injury in the group stage, Garrincha stepped up brilliantly. His dribbling wizardry and 4 goals carried Brazil to back-to-back titles.
highlights.Brazil1970: Widely considered the greatest World Cup team ever. Pelé, Jairzinho, Tostão, Gérson, and Rivelino played breathtaking football. Brazil won all 6 matches and kept the Jules Rimet trophy permanently.
highlights.Brazil1994: After 24 years, Brazil returned to glory. Romário was the star with 5 goals. The final against Italy was decided on penalties after a 0-0 draw, with Roberto Baggio's famous miss.
highlights.Brazil2002: The 'Three Rs' - Ronaldo, Rivaldo, and Ronaldinho - led Brazil to their 5th title. Ronaldo scored 8 goals including both in the final, completing his redemption after 1998.
highlights.Germany1954: The 'Miracle of Bern'. West Germany defeated the mighty Hungarians who had beaten them 8-3 in the group stage. Helmut Rahn scored the winning goal in a stunning 3-2 comeback victory.
highlights.Germany1974: Franz Beckenbauer's 'Der Kaiser' era. Despite going behind to a Cruyff-inspired Dutch penalty, Gerd Müller's winning goal secured the title on home soil.
highlights.Germany1990: Redemption for 1986. Andreas Brehme's late penalty defeated Maradona's Argentina in a rematch of the previous final. Lothar Matthäus was the driving force.
highlights.Germany2014: The historic 7-1 demolition of Brazil in Belo Horizonte stunned the world. Mario Götze's extra-time winner in the final secured Germany's 4th title.
highlights.Italy1934: Italy's first World Cup on home soil. Coach Vittorio Pozzo's team came from behind in the final, with Angelo Schiavio scoring the winner in extra time.
highlights.Italy1938: Back-to-back titles under Pozzo. Silvio Piola starred with 5 goals as Italy became the first nation to successfully defend the World Cup.
highlights.Italy1982: Paolo Rossi's redemption after a match-fixing ban. His hat-trick against Brazil and 6 tournament goals led Italy to glory. Marco Tardelli's iconic celebration in the final.
highlights.Italy2006: Gianluigi Buffon and the Italian defense were nearly impenetrable. The final is remembered for Zidane's headbutt. Fabio Grosso scored the winning penalty.
highlights.Argentina1978: Argentina's first World Cup on home soil amid political controversy. Mario Kempes was the star with 6 goals including 2 in the final against the Netherlands.
highlights.Argentina1986: Diego Maradona's tournament. His 'Hand of God' and 'Goal of the Century' against England defined the competition. He dragged Argentina to glory almost single-handedly.
highlights.Argentina2022: Lionel Messi's crowning glory. After a shock opening loss to Saudi Arabia, Argentina recovered brilliantly. The final against France is considered the greatest ever, with Messi finally lifting the trophy.
highlights.France1998: France's first World Cup on home soil. Zinedine Zidane's two headers in the final crushed Brazil. The multiethnic squad united the nation under 'Black-Blanc-Beur'.
highlights.France2018: A young, talented squad led by 19-year-old Kylian Mbappé. Antoine Griezmann and Paul Pogba starred as France claimed their second title with dominant attacking play.
highlights.Uruguay1930: The first ever World Cup, hosted to celebrate Uruguay's centenary. Despite trailing 2-1 at halftime, Uruguay stormed back to beat rivals Argentina in the inaugural final.
highlights.Uruguay1950: The 'Maracanazo'. Uruguay silenced 200,000 fans in Rio's Maracanã, coming from behind to beat Brazil 2-1 in the deciding match. One of football's greatest upsets.
highlights.England1966: England's only World Cup. Geoff Hurst's hat-trick in the final, including the controversial 'Wembley Goal', secured victory. Bobby Moore lifted the Jules Rimet trophy.
highlights.Spain2010: Tiki-taka perfection. Despite losing the opener, Spain's possession-based football prevailed. Andrés Iniesta's extra-time winner against Netherlands completed their 2008-2012 dominance.

Fares, timetables, and service availability may fluctuate based on carrier policies, seasonal demand, operational conditions, and other factors beyond our control. We make no warranties or representations regarding the accuracy, timeliness, or completeness of any transportation information presented. Users are strongly advised to independently verify all details, including current fares, schedules, and booking terms, directly with the respective transportation providers or authorized booking agents prior to making any travel arrangements or financial commitments.

criticalInfo.title: Critical Info
criticalInfo.subtitle: Essential safety and travel information for FIFA 2026 World Cup visitors.

unsafeNeighborhoods.title: Unsafe Neighborhoods Near Stadium
unsafeNeighborhoods.description: Stadium flanked by areas that vary in safety block-by-block.
unsafeNeighborhoods.tips: Stick to pedestrian crowds. Use designated ride-share lots. If crowd thins out, turn back.

followHomeRobberies.title: Follow-Home Robberies (Luxury Items)
followHomeRobberies.description: Thieves target people wearing expensive jewelry/watches leaving venues.
followHomeRobberies.tips: Dress down when leaving stadium. Tuck chains inside shirt, avoid flashing luxury watches.

pickpocketing.title: Pickpocketing at Transit Hubs
pickpocketing.description: High-density choke points like entry gates, escalators, and crowded transit platforms.
pickpocketing.tips: Keep valuables in front pockets or bags worn across body. Stay alert in crowded spaces.

ticketScams.title: Ticket and Merchandise Scams
ticketScams.description: Fake tickets and counterfeit jerseys sold outside stadiums.
ticketScams.tips: Only buy from official apps (Ticketmaster, FIFA). Never buy from individuals on the street.

carBreakIns.title: Car Break-Ins & Parking Lot Safety
carBreakIns.description: Thieves smash car windows to grab bags in seconds, often in broad daylight.
carBreakIns.tips: Never leave anything visible in rental cars. Leave back seats folded down so thieves can see trunk is empty.

heatWarning.title: Heat Warning
heatWarning.description: Extreme heat and humidity in June/July. Heat exhaustion is a real risk.
heatWarning.tips: Drink water constantly, wear sunscreen, take breaks in shade, know heat stroke signs.

emergencySection.title: Emergency Information
emergencySection.subtitle: Important information for your safety and convenience

911.title: 911 Emergency Number
911.description: Call 911 for Police/Fire/Ambulance (Life threatening emergencies only). Available 24/7.

988.title: 988 Crisis Hotline
988.description: Call 988 for Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (Mental Health emergencies). Free and available to tourists 24/7.

311.title: 311 Non-Emergency
311.description: Call 311 for non-emergency city services (noise complaints, lost property). Available in most host cities.

medicalLocator.title: Medical Facility Locator
medicalLocator.description: Find the nearest Emergency Rooms and Urgent Care centers near each stadium. Tap to open the Medical Locator with maps and directions.

tipping.title: Tipping is Mandatory
tipping.description: 18-22% for dining, $1-2 USD per drink at bars, $2-5 USD for hotel housekeeping per night. Use the app's tipping calculator.

salesTax.title: Sales Tax Not Included
salesTax.description: Prices on shelves are PRE-TAX. At the register, expect 6-10% higher. Unlike Europe/Asia, tourists CANNOT get a VAT/Sales Tax refund at the airport.

creditHolds.title: Credit Card Holds
creditHolds.description: Hotels and rental cars place $200-$500 USD "holds" on cards. This reduces your spending limit immediately. Avoid using debit cards as money actually leaves your account.

alcoholAge.title: Alcohol Age 21 Strictly Enforced
alcoholAge.description: Drinking age is strictly 21. Passport is the only guaranteed accepted ID. Walking with open containers (beer) is illegal in almost all cities.

cannabis.title: Cannabis Federal Crime Warning
cannabis.description: Marijuana is legal in many states (CA, NY, MA) but ILLEGAL FEDERALLY. Bringing it across state lines or into airports is a federal crime. Never have it on federal land.

rightTurn.title: Right Turn on Red
rightTurn.description: Legal everywhere UNLESS sign says "No Turn on Red". Exception: Illegal in New York City. 4-way stops: First to arrive goes first.

esim.title: eSIM for Mobile Data
esim.description: US carriers shut down 3G. Phone must support VoLTE. Use Airalo or GigSky eSIM apps for data instead of expensive physical SIM cards.

metric.title: Metric to Imperial Guide
metric.description: 100°F = 38°C (Very Hot), 32°F = 0°C (Freezing). 1 Mile = 1.6 KM. Date format: MM/DD/YYYY (12/10/26 = December 10th).

restrooms.title: Public Restrooms Rare
restrooms.description: US cities have very few public toilets. Use hotel lobbies or large department stores. Check the app's restroom locator.

emergency.title: Emergency Services
emergency.selectCity: Select a city to view nearby medical facilities

consulates.title: Consulates
consulates.selectCity: Select a city to view consulate information
cannotDoList: Pay your bills or give you money

travelEntrySection.title: Travel & Entry
travelEntrySection.subtitle: Entry requirements, visas, and consular services

consulateTips.title: CONSULATE TIPS
items: Save your consulate's number before traveling
Register with your embassy for travel alerts
Consulates can NOT post bail or provide legal representation
Most consulates close on local AND home country holidays

esta.title: ESTA
esta.description: $21 USD, apply 72 hours before (UK, EU, Australia, Japan, 41 countries)

b1b2.title: B-1/B-2 Visa
b1b2.description: Required for Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, Colombia, etc.

fifa-pass.title: FIFA Pass
fifa-pass.description: Expedited visa interviews for official ticket holders

firstPointOfEntry.title: First Point of Entry Rule (Critical)
firstPointOfEntry.description: You MUST clear Immigration and Customs at your FIRST US airport, even if connecting to another city.

mpcTip.title: Tip: Download Mobile Passport Control (MPC) app for express lanes

customs-declaration.title: Customs Declaration Form
customs-declaration.description: Complete CBP Declaration Form 6059B on the plane or use the CBP One app. Declare all food, plants, and items over $800 USD value.

duty-free.title: Duty-Free Allowances
duty-free.description: Adults can bring: 1L alcohol, 200 cigarettes or 100 cigars (non-Cuban), gifts up to $100 USD. Over limits = pay duty tax.

cash-declaration.title: Cash Declaration Required
cash-declaration.description: MUST declare if carrying $10,000+ USD in cash/monetary instruments. Failure to declare = seizure and potential criminal charges.

food-restrictions.title: Food & Agriculture Restrictions
food-restrictions.description: Many foods PROHIBITED: fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, dairy from most countries. Fines up to $10,000 USD. Declare everything or dispose before customs.

global-entry.title: Global Entry / TSA PreCheck
global-entry.description: If you have Global Entry, use automated kiosks for faster processing. TSA PreCheck speeds up domestic security lines.

citySafetySection.title: City Safety Guide
citySafetySection.subtitle: Select a host city to view safety information

miami.heatWarning: Heat index can reach 120°F (49°C) in June/July. High humidity makes cooling difficult. Heat exhaustion is a serious risk.
miami.ticketScams: Beware of fake tickets sold near Hard Rock Stadium. Only buy from FIFA.com or Ticketmaster. Counterfeit jerseys common on streets.
localConcerns: Hurricane season runs June-November - monitor weather alerts
Strong sun exposure - wear SPF 50+ and reapply frequently
Mosquitoes carry diseases - use repellent especially at dawn/dusk
Rip currents at beaches - swim only at lifeguarded areas

safeAreas.name: Miami Beach
safeAreas.description: Tourist-friendly beachfront with heavy police presence, well-lit Art Deco district, and 24/7 activity on Ocean Drive.

safeAreas.name: Brickell
safeAreas.description: Miami's financial district with upscale high-rises, modern restaurants, and excellent walkability. Very safe day and night.

safeAreas.name: Coral Gables

safeAreas.name: Coconut Grove

safeAreas.name: Wynwood

tips: Use Uber/Lyft instead of walking long distances in heat

houston.heatWarning: Temperatures regularly exceed 105°F (40°C). Subtropical humidity makes it feel even hotter. All 21 risky heat days in 2025 summer were climate-change-induced.
houston.ticketScams: NRG Stadium area sees scalpers with fake tickets. Parking lot scams common - only use official lots.
localConcerns: Flash flooding during summer storms - avoid underpasses
Power grid can strain during heat waves
Wide spread city - public transit limited, plan transportation
Traffic congestion severe - allow extra time

safeAreas.name: Downtown

dallas.ticketScams: AT&T Stadium (Arlington) is massive - scammers operate in parking areas. Fake parking passes sold online.
localConcerns: Severe thunderstorms and tornadoes possible in June
Stadium is in Arlington - 20 miles from Dallas, plan transport
Very car-dependent - limited public transit to stadium
Toll roads everywhere - have cash or TollTag

localConcerns: Traffic among worst in USA - MARTA train recommended

safeAreas.name: Decatur

safeAreas.name: Manhattan Beach

localConcerns: Rain possible even in summer - bring layers

mexico-city.heatWarning: High altitude (7,350 ft) means cooler temps than expected (70-80°F). But altitude sickness is a concern - acclimatize before exertion.
mexico-city.ticketScams: Azteca Stadium area has sophisticated scam operations. Counterfeit tickets look very real. Only buy from FIFA.com.
localConcerns: Altitude sickness - take it easy first 2 days
Pickpocketing on Metro (especially Line B)
Police extortion possible
Tap water unsafe - drink only bottled
Air pollution can be severe

safeAreas.name: Polanco
safeAreas.description: Mexico City's most upscale neighborhood with designer boutiques, world-class restaurants, and excellent museums. Very safe.

safeAreas.name: Roma Norte
safeAreas.description: Trendy bohemian neighborhood with Art Deco architecture, hip cafes, and vibrant food scene. Popular with expats.

safeAreas.name: Condesa
safeAreas.description: Leafy, walkable neighborhood with Art Nouveau buildings, outdoor cafes in Parque México, and excellent nightlife.

safeAreas.name: Coyoacán
safeAreas.description: Historic colonial neighborhood with Frida Kahlo Museum, cobblestone streets, and charming central plaza. Family-friendly.

safeAreas.name: Santa Fe
safeAreas.description: Modern business district with gleaming towers, upscale malls, and international hotels. Corporate and very secure.

tips: Use Uber/DiDi exclusively - never street taxis
Drink lots of water for altitude

guadalajara.heatWarning: Warm but not extreme (80-90°F). Rainy season June-October means afternoon thunderstorms daily.
guadalajara.ticketScams: Estadio Akron area sees fake ticket sales. Only use official FIFA channels.
localConcerns: Jalisco state has cartel presence - stick to tourist areas
Motorcycle phone-snatchers in Colonia Americana & Centro
Very different safety day vs night
Limited English spoken outside tourist areas

safeAreas.name: Colonia Americana
safeAreas.description: Expat-friendly neighborhood with Art Deco mansions, trendy cafes, and Chapultepec Avenue nightlife. Hip and walkable.

safeAreas.name: Providencia
safeAreas.description: Upscale residential area with excellent restaurants, shopping centers, and tree-lined streets. Very safe neighborhood.

safeAreas.name: Zapopan
safeAreas.description: Home to the famous Basílica with added security, modern shopping malls, and growing restaurant scene.

safeAreas.name: Chapalita
safeAreas.description: Family-oriented residential area with parks, local shops, and quiet streets. Excellent for families with children.

safeAreas.name: Historic Center
safeAreas.description: Beautiful colonial architecture with the Cathedral and Teatro Degollado. Safe during daytime with police presence.

tips: Use Uber for any night travel

monterrey.heatWarning: Desert climate with temps regularly exceeding 100°F (38°C) in June/July. Very dry heat.
monterrey.ticketScams: Estadio BBVA area - same caution as other Mexican cities. Use only official ticket sources.
localConcerns: Nuevo León state has cartel activity history
Very hot and dry - stay hydrated
Business city - less tourist infrastructure
Some areas near US border are high-risk

safeAreas.name: San Pedro Garza García
safeAreas.description: Mexico's wealthiest municipality with luxury malls, fine dining, and private security. Essentially a gated community feel.

safeAreas.name: Valle Oriente
safeAreas.description: Modern business district with corporate towers, upscale hotels, and excellent restaurants. Very well-patrolled.

safeAreas.name: Cumbres
safeAreas.description: Upscale residential area popular with families, featuring shopping plazas and a suburban atmosphere.

safeAreas.name: Centro
safeAreas.description: Historic downtown with the famous Macroplaza and Barrio Antiguo. Safe during daytime with tourist police presence.

safeAreas.name: Barrio Antiguo
safeAreas.description: Trendy nightlife district with bars, restaurants, and art galleries. Popular and well-lit in evenings.

toronto.heatWarning: Generally comfortable (75-85°F) but humidity can spike. More temperate than US southern cities.
toronto.ticketScams: BMO Field is smaller venue - less scam activity but still use only official ticket sources.
localConcerns: High cost of living - everything expensive
TTC public transit reliable but crowded
Gun violence has increased in some areas
Very multicultural - respect diversity

safeAreas.name: Downtown Core
safeAreas.description: Financial district with CN Tower, PATH underground shopping, and major attractions. Busy and well-policed.

safeAreas.name: Yorkville
safeAreas.description: Toronto's most upscale neighborhood with designer boutiques, celebrity sightings, and fine dining. Very safe.

safeAreas.name: The Annex
safeAreas.description: Vibrant neighborhood near University of Toronto with Victorian homes, bookstores, and diverse restaurants.

safeAreas.name: Leslieville
safeAreas.description: Trendy east-end neighborhood with indie shops, brunch spots, and a strong community feel. Family-friendly.

safeAreas.name: Distillery District
safeAreas.description: Beautifully restored Victorian industrial area with galleries, restaurants, and cobblestone streets. Car-free zone.

tips: Download TTC app for real-time transit

vancouver.heatWarning: Mild summer weather (70-75°F). BC Place is covered stadium. Rain possible even in summer.
vancouver.ticketScams: Less scam activity than US cities but exercise normal caution with unofficial sellers.
localConcerns: Downtown Eastside has visible drug crisis - avoid Hastings Street
Very expensive city - budget accordingly
Wildfire smoke possible from BC interior
Rental housing crisis - book accommodation early

safeAreas.name: Yaletown
safeAreas.description: Converted warehouse district with trendy restaurants, boutiques, and waterfront seawall access. Very walkable and safe.

safeAreas.name: Gastown
safeAreas.description: Historic neighborhood with the famous steam clock, cobblestone streets, and upscale dining. Tourist-friendly (avoid east end).

safeAreas.name: Kitsilano
safeAreas.description: Beach neighborhood with organic cafes, yoga studios, and stunning mountain views. Popular with young professionals.

safeAreas.name: West End
safeAreas.description: Densely populated residential area near Stanley Park and English Bay Beach. LGBTQ-friendly and very safe.

safeAreas.name: North Vancouver
safeAreas.description: Across the harbor with mountain trails, Capilano Suspension Bridge, and suburban safety. Beautiful natural setting.

tips: SkyTrain connects airport to downtown and stadium

prohibitedSection.title: Prohibited Items
prohibitedSection.subtitle: Do not bring these items when entering the United States or stadiums

clearBagPolicy.title: CLEAR BAG POLICY
clearBagPolicy.description: Most stadiums only allow clear plastic bags (max 12" x 6" x 12") or small clutches. Arrive early and check venue-specific rules.

kinderEggs.name: Kinder Surprise Eggs
kinderEggs.description: Banned as choking hazard (toy inside chocolate shell). Regular Kinder products without embedded toys are allowed.

meats.name: Meats (Fresh, Dried, Canned)
meats.description: Cannot bring fresh, dried, or canned meats including bouillon with meat products. This includes beef jerky, ham, salami, and meat-based instant noodle seasonings.

fruitsVegetables.name: Fresh Fruits & Vegetables
fruitsVegetables.description: Almost all fresh produce prohibited to prevent invasive pests. This includes fruits, vegetables, seeds, and plants. Some items may be allowed from Canada/Mexico.

dairy.name: Dairy Products
dairy.description: Most dairy products prohibited except hard cheeses. No milk, cream, butter, or soft cheeses from most countries.

cannabis.name: Marijuana/Cannabis/CBD
cannabis.description: Strictly prohibited at airports and borders despite state legality. Federal jurisdiction applies at all ports of entry. CBD products also prohibited if they contain any THC.

prescription.name: Prescription Medications (Undeclared)
prescription.description: Must be in original labeled containers with prescription. Some medications legal in your country may be controlled substances in the US (e.g., codeine, some sleep aids).

cashOver10k.name: Cash Over $10,000 (Undeclared)
cashOver10k.description: No limit on cash, but MUST declare on FinCEN Form 105 if carrying over $10,000 USD. Includes cash equivalents like traveler's checks and money orders.
cashOver10k.penalty: Seizure of ALL cash if not declared

drones.name: Drones
drones.description: Can bring through customs but must register with FAA if over 250g. Strict No Drone Zones around all stadiums during matches. Flying near stadium is federal crime.
drones.penalty: Federal crime if flown near stadium

counterfeit.name: Counterfeit Goods
counterfeit.description: Fake designer items, knockoff jerseys, and pirated media are seized at customs. Genuine items for personal use are fine.

cubanProducts.name: Cuban Cigars & Products
cubanProducts.description: Cuban cigars and rum are prohibited from entering the United States regardless of where purchased.

firearms.name: Undeclared Firearms
firearms.description: All firearms must be declared and transported in checked luggage only, unloaded and in locked hard-sided container. Never in carry-on.

knives.name: Knives & Sharp Objects
knives.description: No knives, box cutters, or sharp objects in carry-on luggage. Must be in checked bags.

backpacks.name: Backpacks & Large Bags
backpacks.description: No backpacks, sports bags, or bags larger than 12" x 6" x 12". Most stadiums enforce CLEAR BAG POLICY - only transparent bags allowed.

coolers.name: Coolers & Hard-Sided Containers
coolers.description: No coolers, hard-sided bags, or luggage allowed inside stadium.

proCameras.name: Professional Cameras
proCameras.description: No cameras with lenses over 200mm. No detachable lens cameras without media credentials. Phone cameras and small point-and-shoots allowed.

tripods.name: Tripods & Selfie Sticks
tripods.description: No tripods, monopods, or selfie sticks allowed in stadium.

drones.name: Drones
drones.description: Absolute ban on drones near stadiums. No Drone Zone extends several miles around each venue during matches.

laptops.name: Laptops
laptops.description: Laptops generally not allowed. Tablets without keyboard cases usually permitted.

airhorns.name: Air Horns & Vuvuzelas
airhorns.description: No air horns, vuvuzelas, or compressed air noisemakers. These are strictly banned at all FIFA events.

drums.name: Drums & Musical Instruments
drums.description: No drums, megaphones, or large musical instruments unless part of official supporter group with permission.

outsideFood.name: Outside Food & Beverages
outsideFood.description: No outside food or drinks allowed. Exception for medical needs, baby food, and sealed water bottles (some venues).

alcohol.name: Alcohol
alcohol.description: No outside alcohol. Alcohol sold inside stadium but consumption regulated. Visibly intoxicated fans may be denied entry.

umbrellas.name: Large Umbrellas
umbrellas.description: No large or rigid umbrellas. Small collapsible umbrellas may be allowed at some venues.

flagsPoles.name: Flags with Poles
flagsPoles.description: No flag poles, sticks, or rigid supports. Flags larger than 2m x 1.5m prohibited. Hand-held flags without poles allowed.

laserPointers.name: Laser Pointers
laserPointers.description: Absolutely banned. Using laser pointer at players or officials is criminal offense.

fireworks.name: Fireworks & Flares
fireworks.description: No fireworks, flares, smoke bombs, or pyrotechnics of any kind.

political.name: Political/Offensive Material
political.description: No political banners, discriminatory symbols, or offensive materials. FIFA has strict anti-discrimination policies.

airportNotes.opf: Preferred for private jets. Less congested than MIA. 24/7 CBP available.
airportNotes.mia-pvt: Full CBP on-site. Higher traffic but convenient location.
airportNotes.teb: Manhattan's closest private jet option. World's busiest business aviation airport. Slots go fast - book early!
airportNotes.hpn: Second choice for Manhattan. Less traffic than Teterboro.
airportNotes.vny: World's busiest private jet airport. No commercial traffic. Full CBP.
airportNotes.lgb: Avoids LAX traffic. Popular alternative with full services.
airportNotes.smo: Intimate, discreet. Limited to smaller jets. No on-site CBP.
airportNotes.dal: One of busiest private jet airports in US. Full CBP services.
airportNotes.ads: Ideal for North Dallas. High-end FBOs. No on-site CBP.
airportNotes.dfw-pvt: Major hub with private terminals. Full international clearance.
airportNotes.hou: Top-ranked private jet airport. Closest to NRG Stadium. Full CBP.
airportNotes.iah-pvt: Major international hub. Full-service private terminals.
airportNotes.pdk: Preferred for private jets. 600+ daily operations. No CBP - clear at ATL first.
airportNotes.atl-pvt: World's busiest airport. Full CBP. Longer taxi times.
airportNotes.bed: Premier private jet airport. Less congestion than Logan.
airportNotes.bos-pvt: Full CBP on-site. Only FBO at Logan. Convenient city access.
airportNotes.bfi: Primary private aviation airport. Full CBP. Close to downtown.
airportNotes.sea-pvt: Major international hub. Full services but busy commercial traffic.
airportNotes.pne: Primary private jet airport for Philly. No CBP on-site.
airportNotes.phl-pvt: Full CBP services. Commercial traffic can cause delays.
airportNotes.sql: Popular Silicon Valley airport. No on-site CBP.
airportNotes.sjc-pvt: Closest major airport to stadium. Full CBP on-site.
airportNotes.oak-pvt: Full international clearance. Less traffic than SFO.
airportNotes.mkc: Closest to Arrowhead Stadium. General aviation focused.
airportNotes.mci-pvt: Full CBP services. Primary international entry point.
airportNotes.opa: Major private aviation hub. Just 5 miles from Hard Rock Stadium.
airportNotes.fll-pvt: International hub with excellent private terminals.
airportNotes.tlc: REQUIRED for private jets (MEX doesn't accept private). 70%+ of Mexico's private jets use this. On-site CIQ.
airportNotes.gdl: Large FBO facilities. On-site customs. 24/7 private aviation support.
airportNotes.ntr: Preferred for private aviation. VIP terminals. 24/7 service.
airportNotes.mty: International connections. Separate private aviation terminals.
airportNotes.yyz-pvt: Full CBSA services. Canada's busiest airport. Private terminals available.
airportNotes.ykz: General aviation. Clear customs at Pearson first.
airportNotes.yvr-pvt: Full CBSA services. South Terminal for GA. Beautiful approach.

marinaFeatures.islandGardens: Deep water, 50 superyacht berths, 24hr immigration, IGY managed
marinaFeatures.oneIslandPark: 100m+ yachts only, VIP concierge, fastest ocean access

yachtInfo.title: Superyacht Berths
yachtInfo.description: Book marina berths 6+ months ahead during World Cup. Miami has the best superyacht infrastructure in the US.

yachtChecklist.title: YACHT ENTRY CHECKLIST
items: Report arrival via CBP ROAM app within 24 hours
Fly Q flag when entering territorial waters
Stay onboard until customs clearance complete
All passengers report to nearest CBP office
Foreign yachts 300+ tons: notify USCG 96 hrs ahead
Apply for cruising license at first port of entry

eapis.desc: Submit via CBP eAPIS system before departure. Include all passenger/crew info.

decal.desc: Annual CBP Private Aircraft Decal required. Purchase via DTOPS ($29.96/year).

permission.desc: Contact destination CBP port before departure from foreign area.

airports.desc: 381 airports accept private international arrivals. Verify your destination.

preclearance.desc: Available in Shannon (Ireland) and Aruba for faster US entry.

report.desc: All yachts arriving from foreign ports must report via CBP ROAM app or phone.

qFlag.desc: Fly yellow quarantine flag when entering 12-mile territorial waters until cleared.

stayOnboard.desc: No one may leave or board until customs processing is complete.

uscg.desc: Foreign yachts over 300 gross tons must notify USCG 96 hours before arrival.

cruisingLicense.desc: Foreign-flagged yachts from certain countries can get 1-year cruising license.

dtops.desc: Required for boats 30+ feet. Purchase annually ($29.96).

apis.desc: Advance Passenger Information required for all private flights.

permits.desc: Now required (no more annual authorization). Plan 10+ business days lead time.

insurance.desc: Aircraft make/model/serial/tail must exactly match registration.

restrictions.desc: Private jets restricted to designated airports (MEX closed to private).

apis.desc: Required for international arrivals to Canada.

canpass.desc: CANPASS Private Aircraft program available for expedited clearance.

cbsa.desc: Advance customs arrangements required through FBO/handler.

tips: Book FBO slots early during World Cup - demand will be extremely high
Helicopter transfers available from most major airports to stadiums
Mexico City private jets MUST use Toluca (TLC), not MEX airport
Yacht berths in Miami will be premium - book 6+ months ahead
Consider fractional jet programs if you don't own - NetJets, Flexjet, VistaJet
All 3 host countries require advance passenger manifests (APIS/eAPIS)
